mainEntity.name: Dual Form
mainEntity.description:
Born in Wakefield in 1903, Barbara Hepworth is regarded as a pre-eminent British sculptor, along with her peer and fellow Yorkshire native, Henry Moore. In 1965, the year that she produced Dual Form, she was made Dame Commander of the British Empire (DBE) and was also made the first female trustee of the Tate Gallery.

Dual Form is one of an edition of seven bronzes, a medium that Hepworth began working in towards the late 1950s. With its simple form and pierced hollows, it recalls Hepworthâ€™s earlier work in wood. The sculpture was acquired by the Leeds Art Fund in 1967 and is on loan from Leeds Art Gallery.

contributor.name: Leeds Art Fund
contributor.description: Lent by Leeds Art Fund (Leeds Museums & Galleries)
